document.docTitle: Monatractides humilis Pešić & Smit, 2011, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Water mites of the genus Monatractides Viets (Acari: Hydrachnidia, Torrenticolidae) from New Guinea, with descriptions of nine new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Water mites of the genus Monatractides Viets (Acari: Hydrachnidia, Torrenticolidae) from New Guinea, with descriptions of nine new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type series.
Holotype , male, dissected and slide mounted; Indonesia , New Guinea , Papua Province: River Pos 7 , Sentani,
9 .iii.2010
, 2˚
33.740 S
140 ˚
30.784 E
, 103 m a.s.l.. Paratypes : 1 / 1 (mounted), same data as holotype ; 8 / 5 ( 2 / 2 mounted), River Yabawi, upstream of Harapan,
28 .iii.2010
, 2˚
34.216 S
140 ˚
33.723 E
, 120 m a.s.l.

Diagnosis. Idiosoma L < 900 in males, < 1000 in females; area of primary sclerotization of the dorsal plate with four dorsoglandularia; capitular bay narrow (L/W ratio ca. 3.0); distal margins of P- 2 and - 3 without denticles, P- 4 with well well visible denticle near the insertion of the ventral hairs, P- 4 L/H
2.2 – 2.3
; postgenital area large; excretory pore away from the line of primary sclerotization, Vgl- 2 posterior and well separated from the excretory pore.

Female (from River Pos 7 , in parentheses paratype from River Yabawi): Idiosoma (ventral view:
Fig. 17
H) L 925 ( 975 ), W 625 ( 669 ); dorsal shield L 744 ( 794 ), W 550 ( 563 ), L/W ratio 1.35 ( 1.4 ); dorsal plate 706 ( 759 ); shoulder plate L 197 ( 191 ), W 78 ( 78 ), L/W ratio 2.5 ( 2.45 ); frontal plate L 124 ( 141 ), W 59 ( 59 ), L/W ratio 2.1 ( 2.39 ); shoulder/frontal plate L ratio 1.59 ( 1.36 ); capitular bay L 194 ( 200 ), W 72 ( 72 ), L/W ratio 2.7 ( 2.8 ); Cx- 1 total L 319 ( 325 ), Cx- 1 medial L 125 ( 125 ), Cx- 2 + 3 medial 59 ( 68 ); ratio Cx- 1 L/Cx- 2 + 3 medial L 5.4 ( 4.8 ); Cx- 1 medial L/Cx- 2 + 3 medial L 2.1 ( 1.8 ); genital field L/W 188 ( 194 )/ 154 ( 158 ), L/W ratio 1.22 ( 1.23 ); distance genital field–excretory pore 200 ( 197 ), genital field–caudal idiosoma margin 350 ( 367 ); capitulum ventral L 225 ( 222 ); chelicera total L 257 ( 259 ); palp total L 240 ( 245 ), dL: P-1, 33 ( 34 ); P-2, 69 ( 71 ); P-3, 45 ( 46 ); P-4, 65 ( 66 ); P-5, 28 ( 28 ); %L: P- 1 , 13.8 ( 13.9 ); P- 2 , 28.8 (29.0); P- 3 , 18.8 ( 18.8 ); P- 4 , 27.1 ( 26.9 ); P- 5 , 11.7 ( 11.4 ); L P- 2 /P- 4 ratio, 1.06 ( 1.08 ); L I-L- 4-6 : 129 ( 132 ), 125 ( 132 ), 119 ( 127 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 17A–G .
Monatractides humilis
sp. nov.
(A – G = male, H = female): A = dorsal shield; B, H = ventral shield; C = I-L- 5 and -6; D = ejaculatory complex; E = palp, medial view; F = palp, lateral view; G = capitulum. Scale bars = 100 µm.

FIGURE 18A–D.
Monatractides papillatus (Smit, 1996)
, male: A = dorsal shield; B = ventral shield; C = palp, medial view; D = I-L-5 and -6. Scale bars = 100 µm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. Named for its occurrence at lower elevations.
Discussion. See discussion section under the preceeding species.
